title: Toulouse-Lautrec and the Art of the Poster
description: One-minute skill: Toulouse-Lautrec and the Art of the Poster.

hook.text: A 4'8" aristocrat with broken legs became the defining artist of Parisian nightlife.

buildup.text: Toulouse-Lautrec documented Moulin Rouge dancers, singers, and performers in bold flat colors.

discovery.text: He elevated the commercial poster into fine art â€” blending Japanese prints with Parisian energy.

twist.text: His aristocratic family disowned him. He found his real family in cabarets and brothels.

climax.text: Modern advertising, graphic design, and pop art all trace back to his poster work.

punchline.text: He turned advertisements into art. Sound familiar?

quiz.question: What did Toulouse-Lautrec pioneer?
options: Elevating commercial posters into fine art
